channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Van der Waals β-Ga<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> thin films on polycrystalline diamond substrates
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 31 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63666-x

Growth of uniform crystalline β-Ga2O3 on poly-diamond substrates is achieved using a graphene interlayer to facilitate nucleation, enabling ultralow interfacial thermal resistance, overcoming lattice mismatch and alleviating thermal expansion stress.
item.dc:title: Van der Waals β-Ga<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> thin films on polycrystalline diamond substrates
item.dc:creator: Jing Ning
Zhichun Yang
Haidi Wu
Xinmeng Dong
Yaning Zhang
Yufei Chen
Xinbo Zhang
Dong Wang
Yue Hao
Jincheng Zhang

item.title: Lanthanum-assisted lattice anchoring of iridium in Co<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub> for efficient oxygen evolution reaction in low-iridium water electrolysis
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 31 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63577-x

Hydrogen production via proton exchange membrane water electrolysis is limited by the high cost and scarcity of iridium catalysts. By doping lanthanum into cobalt oxide, the authors anchor iridium atoms within the oxide lattice, boosting oxygen evolution activity and stability and reducing iridium loading.
item.dc:title: Lanthanum-assisted lattice anchoring of iridium in Co<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub> for efficient oxygen evolution reaction in low-iridium water electrolysis
item.dc:creator: Zhuoming Wei
Yunxuan Ding
Weili Shi
Feiyang Zhang
Yuxiang Song
Xin Cui
Yu Guo
Licheng Sun
Qike Jiang
Biaobiao Zhang

item.title: Single-component-based multicolor emissions enabled by symmetry breaking
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 30 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63519-7

Excitation-dependent multicolour emission is desirable, but hard to obtain. Here, the authors report the development of a molecular symmetry breaking strategy to all excitation-dependent multicolour emissions from one chemical entity.
item.dc:title: Single-component-based multicolor emissions enabled by symmetry breaking
item.dc:creator: Simin Lin

Huisi Li
